sourceResource.title: Food safety at home podcasts
Food safety at home podcasts
description: Updated irregularly
Audio files in MP3 format available in both streaming and downloadable options.

A collection of instructions targeted to lay cooks and families for safely preparing, serving, and storing a broad range of food types in a wide range of contexts, e.g., holidays and emergency situations with power losses. Also covers common foodborne diseases and their prevention.
Audio podcasts each are accompanied by transcript in HTML format.
Description based on: version last updated Apr. 25, 2012; title from title screen (viewed October 30, 2014).

sourceResource.title: Student aid audio guide student financial assistance
description: Annual
Description based on: 2001-2002; title from container.
Distributed to depository libraries in Eric version microfiche classed as Supt. of Docs. class no.: ED 1.310/2:, 1999-2002.
Title also appears in braille on container.

Information on financial aid programs and state and private sources of aid, including for visually impaired students, is explained through a telephone dialogue between a counselor at the Department's Federal Student Aid Information Center and a student.
Current issue also available via Internet at the ED web site. Address as of 8/15/02: http://www.ed.gov/offices/OSFAP/Students/student.html; current access is available via PURL.
Issued also in braille.
Issued also in microfiche.

sourceResource.title: NIH radio. NIH research radio podcasts
NIH radio. NIH research radio podcasts
description: Updated every other Friday
Streaming and downloadable audio files in MP3 format.
[A] service of the Office of Communications & Public Liaison.
Each ... podcast contains two or three audio reports, plus an extra, in-depth interview. Each episode is 15-25 minutes long designed for a general audience.
Transcripts in HTML format provided for 2007- . "Show notes" in HTML format accompany archived episodes for 2006.
Episode #0001 also called: Premiere edition.
Description based on: Episode #0133 (May 6, 2011); title from title screen (viewed May 11, 2011).

sourceResource.title: NIH radio. NIH audio reports
NIH radio. NIH audio reports
description: Two times per week
Streaming and downloadable audio files in MP3 format and transcripts in HTML format.
[A] service of the Office of Communications & Public Liaison.

Each report is based on a current press release and typically contains soundbites from NIH experts. They are one to four minutes long and health-related. They can be broadcast as is, or can be used as source material for other journalistic purposes.
Description based on: May 4, 2011 update; title from title screen (viewed May 11, 2011).

sourceResource.title: Food safety for meat, poultry, and processed egg product inspection podcasts
Food safety for meat, poultry, and processed egg product inspection podcasts
description: Updated irregularly
Audio files in MP3 format available in both streaming and downloadable options.

Initially, ... podcasts will be targeted toward the owners and operators of small and very small meat, poultry and processed egg products establishments, since these plants represent over 90% of the total number that FSIS inspects every day.... [Later] others [will be] targeted to consumers and the general public"--Introd. to FSIS Podcasts (Apr. 20, 2009).

A collection of audio podcasts that convey U.S. standards and recommended practices for food safety, food handling, and food inspections that comport with regulations for which the USDA Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) has oversight authority.
Audio podcasts each are accompanied by transcript in HTML format.
Description based on: version last updated May 25, 2010: title from title screen (viewed Apr. 5, 2012).
Latest issue consulted: version last updated May 25, 2010 (viewed Apr. 18, 2012).

sourceResource.title: NIH radio
NIH radio
description: Frequently updated
Streaming and downloadable audio files in MP3 format and transcripts in HTML and ASP formats.
[A] service of the Office of Communications & Public Liaison.

NIH Radio is a 24-hour audio news service designed to provide broadcast radio stations and networks, podcasters and the public with the latest information about NIH research findings, highlights of press conferences, and health campaigns.
NIH audio reports--NIH research radio podcasts--NIH health matters--NIH radio en Español.
Description based on: version reviewed on February 22, 2011; title from title screen (viewed May 11, 2011).
